results.name: Variant of triangle A008301, read by rows of 2*n+1 terms, such that the first column is the secant numbers (A000364).
comment: Foata and Han refer to this as the triangle of Poupard numbers h_n(k). - _N. J. A. Sloane_, Feb 17 2014
Central terms (A125054) equal the binomial transform of the tangent numbers (A000182).
link: Reinhard Zumkeller, Rows n = 0..100 of triangle, flattened

formula: Sum_{k=0..2n} C(2n,k)*T(n,k) = 4^n * A000182(n), where A000182 are the tangent numbers.

mathematica: t[n_, k_] := t[n, k] = If[2*n < k || k < 0, 0, If[n == 0 && k == 0, 1, If[k == 0, Sum[t[n-1, j], {j, 0, 2*n-2}], If[k <= n, t[n, k-1] + 2*Sum[t[n-1, j], {j, k-1, 2*n-1-k}], t[n, 2*n-k]]]]]; Table[t[n, k], {n, 0, 6}, {k, 0, 2*n}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Dec 06 2012, translated from Pari *)

g xs y = y' : g (tail $ init xs) y' where y' = sum xs + y
